alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 2:13PM EDT until September 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CHARLESTON COUNTY... At 207 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate rain across southern Charleston County early this afternoon. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain has fallen so far today between Rantowles across Johns Island to Folly Beach. An additional inch of rain may occur over southern Charleston County by 4 PM. Around 1 PM, law enforcement reported several roads were flooded across Folly Beach. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Johns Island, West Ashley, James Island, Hollywood, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Wadmalaw Island, Yonges Island, Bears Bluff, James Island County Park, Angel Oak Park, Dungannon Heritage Preserve, Rantowles, Huskum Corner Crosroads, Legareville and Beachwalker Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
